content: Hi everyone! I’m pretty new to Rust, I’m about 2/3 of the way through the book but I’m loving the language so far. I’ve never contributed to any project before so I’m a little intimidated. I’m not a “pro” yet, just some old guy trying to change careers. In any case, I’m here to help in any way I can.
Welcome to Rust! What sort of areas are you interested in working on?
I found my way here via a reddit post about wg-prioritization. I can definitely help with triage, but really any kind of grunt work to take some work off the real developers plates :smile:

@Jonathan Chasteen Welcome! Feel free to take a peek at #t-compiler/wg-prioritization/alerts to see the Prioritization WG at work! Also you can ask Santiago Pastorino if you’re interested to join the WG

As for helping with code contributions, you might ask @DPC if you need help finding issues to work on.
Thanks for the warm welcome, all. This is why I love Rust :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:

Hi everyone, I am also pretty new to rust and about halfway through the book and learning concepts that were relatively harder before "the book" happended. I am a beginner and will be happy to take some work off the shoulders of awesome rustaceans in any way this community deems fit

Hi y'all! I'm Olivia and I do linux/go/python stuff for money and embedded stuff for fun. Don't have anything specific that I want to work on here, but I'd love to find some places to help out so I'll probably try and pick up an unloved E-help-wanted bug or two :)

(Also shoutout to the rustc dev guide people, that book made my first PR super easy!)

Hi all. I am pretty interested in what rust does under the hood and here I am. I'd like contribute as much as possible but it would the first relatively big project for me to dig in. I don't know where to start but hopefully I will be useful in some way :wave:
Welcome! What part of the project are you interested in working on?
I would probably prefer to work on the most beginner friendly parts if possible. After I gaining some confidence, can touch the areas that requires more experience I guess.

Hmm, you might be interested in rust-analyzer, their codebase is much easier to work on than the main compiler.
#t-compiler/wg-rls-2.0
Hello all. I'm new here and hoping to get some help on my quest to build Firefox for SPARC Solaris. I know a bit about computers but nothing about Rust.

If you haven't already, see https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/rustc/platform-support.html#tier-2. If if your platform is sparcv9-sun-solaris, you might have to build the toolchain (or cross-compile, but that doesn't sound easier).
My name is William Xu. Glad to see you all.
